The Node.js code is an example of a module file using TypeScript and ES module exports that exports all exports from another module called `loggerMiddleware`. The `tslib` library's `__exportStar` function is utilized to re-export everything from the `./loggerMiddleware` module under the current module's namespace. When this module is imported, it will provide all the exports from `loggerMiddleware`. Additionally, it includes a source map comment for debugging purposes, though that part is not functional in the current code snippet without the corresponding source map file.

Here is the rewritten Node.js code that achieves the same functionality:

```javascript
"use strict";
Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
const { __exportStar } = require("tslib");
__exportStar(require("./loggerMiddleware"), exports);
```
